plants.germinationNeeds: Inoculate hardwood logs (oak, beech) with plug spawn. Mycelium takes 6-18 months to colonize the log (spawn run).
plants.optimalConditions: Fruiting triggered by soaking logs in cool water after full colonization. Prefers shaded, humid environments. Temp: 10-24°C.

plants.germinationNeeds: Can be grown on various substrates like straw, coffee grounds, or sawdust. Quick colonization (2-4 weeks).
plants.optimalConditions: High humidity (85-95%) and fresh air exchange needed for fruiting. Tolerates a wide temperature range depending on the strain.

plants.germinationNeeds: Typically grown on supplemented hardwood sawdust blocks. Colonization takes about 2-3 weeks.
plants.optimalConditions: Fruiting requires high humidity and cooler temperatures (15-21°C). Grows 'teeth' instead of caps.

history.notes: Harvested first flush from straw bags.
